sn1.40:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
sn1.40:4.3: Then, late at night, the beautiful Kokanadā the Younger, Pajjunna’s daughter, lighting up the entire Great Wood, went up to the Buddha,
sn1.40:4.5: and recited these verses in the Buddha’s presence:
sn1.40:5.2: beautiful as a flash of lightning.
sn1.40:5.3: Revering the Buddha and the teaching,
sn1.40:5.4: she spoke these verses full of meaning.
sn1.40:6.2: I could analyze it in many different ways.
sn1.40:6.3: However, I will state the meaning in brief
sn1.40:6.4: as far as I have learned it by heart.
sn1.40:7.1: You should never do anything bad
sn1.40:7.2: by speech or mind or body in all the world.
sn1.40:7.3: Having given up sensual pleasures, mindful and aware,
sn1.40:7.4: you shouldn’t keep doing what’s painful and pointless.”
